snippet: The arrest months ago of an official believed to have worked at the Ministry of State Security could mark the biggest intelligence breach for China in years.
abstract: News is circulating that China detained a security official months ago suspected of spying for the United States; it is unclear what kind of information the detainee is suspected of leaking and whether that information has compromised any operations by the Chinese government.

byline.contributor: Steven Lee Myers and Scott Shane contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The arrest months ago of an official believed to have worked at the Ministry of State Security could mark the biggest intelligence breach for China in years.

headline.seo: China Is Said to Detain Official Spying for U.S.
headline.main: Official Suspected of Spying for U.S. Said to Be Held in China
headline.print_headline: China Is Said to Have Detained Intelligence Official Suspected of Spying for U.S.
